comment: Lots of honey and rich toffee. Mild on the tongue with a strong finish.
Nice flavors, velvety smooth, reminds of blue label but not as pretty.  Still a good dram but for the money I’ll go blue label instead.

Beautiful golden yellow. Nice slow legs like slow motion rain. Honey, toffee, marzipan and crème brûlée from an fancy restaurant in the neighborhood. Round, rich, well balanced flavor with warm good lasting finish. Great complement to granny's dark chocolate deserts.
Keep your signature and give me back my birthday whiskey

NOSE: sawdust, burnt sugar, sugar cane

TASTE:  strong menthol, citrus

Water - light water flattened flavor. 

NOSE:  Floral, leathery

TASTE: same menthol and citrus just flattened out
No water needed
Easy to sip straight up or a splash.  Warms the body and the soul; sturdy, earnest, and non-prestending.

Whisky mtl
Honey
Bacardi. Aberfeldy another of their products
Highland de aberfeldy 27 yrs
Glenluvet 18
Glen devront 37 yr
Sherry malt cherry
Coffee toasted

I'd say that it was a surprise to see that, as billed,this stacks up so well against Blue, except  that I'm not that big of a fan of Blue (Green is the king of the realistically priced Walkers) so it doesn't take much. This is a good, solid scotch and a good bottle to keep on hand for respected guest because of its stature and presentation but not likely to be your new "must have on hand" bottle. Four stars is dead on at this price, cut it by a third and it would rise to a 4.3-4.7 in that range with the added value boost. I think this is a marketing issue. They should have billed it as the Platinum killer and priced accordingly. You don't take on Walker from the top of the (again, realistically priced) line, you have to climb the ladder.
